results.title: People of the Netherlands
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: Reviews the history and growth of he Dutch poples; shows their efforts against the sea to secure land enough to support their dense population; and discusses factors influencing the position of the Netherlands among other nations in industry and trade.

results.title: People of the forest
results.brief_description: Surrounding the deep forest of Lake Taganyika is a family of chimpanzees which have been studied for over twenty years by naturalist Jane Goodall and filmed by acclaimed wildlife cinematographer Hugo Van Lawick. Narrated by Donald Sutherland, the documentary traces the life of the old mother Flo, her sons, daughters and grandchildren. A fascinating journey into a community of animals who have developed complex social relationships and behaviour patterns.

results.title: People of the Congo
results.brief_description: The activities and traditions of an African tribe. Scenes include customs of head-binding and facial tattooing, preparation of food, bartering, construction of musical instruments and dancing.

results.title: People of the cities
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield, John Abbott and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Russians”.
An inside look at how the Russians live, showing actual families in their homes, at work and their entertainment. This film deals with city life, in places such as Moscow and Odessa. Narrator, Nick Tate.

results.title: People of Spain
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Clifford J. Kamen
results.brief_description: Shows, by animated maps and live action, the geographical and historical influences which worked in combination to produce the modern nation of Spain. Points out the diverse national strains brought to Iberia by successive waves of settlers, immigrants, and conquerors, including the Romans, Basques, Moors, and Catalans. Shows how the climate and fertility of the soil influence agriculture and settlement and depicts the chief cities, industries and products.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Clifford J. Kamen

results.title: People of Peru
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Clifford J. Kamen
results.brief_description: Covers the history and the peoples of Peru. Of a population of 7,000,000 a third are Indian, a third are mixed blood, and a third are white. Glimpses are given of the lives of these people in their various civilizations. The topography of the country is very varied from perpetual snow in the Andes to desert country where it only rains once in 20-30 years at the coast. Lima the capital was founded by the Spaniards in 1535 ad had many fine architectural features in a lavish mediaeval style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Clifford J. Kamen

results.title: People of Mexico
results.brief_description: A study of the origin and history of the Mexican people; primarily an agricultural nation, the Mexicans living in the rural areas regulate their lives by the seasons, planting and harvesting their corn, marketing it in exchange for the other necessities of life which they cannot grow or make; making their homes and their household utensils and ornaments out of clay and wood. The fiesta or religious ceremonies are part of the routine of village life. In sharp contrast, life in the mining areas of Mexico is very much like life in a mining area anywhere in the world.
